results.title: The Hume highway
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the road link between Melbourne and Sydney, showing the many places of interest along the Hume Highway. Describes the early explorations of Hume and Hovell in 1824; the founding of Melbourne in 1835; travel by coach in the gold rush days; the building of the first railway lines; the introduction of the first internal combustion engines leading to a great increase in mechanical road transportation and the building of the Hume Highway. The latter part of the film shows various places of interest along the Highway between Melbourne and Albury. Commentary by Walter Pym. Photography by J. B. Stirling.

The latter part of the film shows various places of interest along the Highway between Melbourne and Albury. Commentary by Walter Pym. Photography by J. B. Stirling.

results.title: The Humble force
results.creator_credit: Phase Three Films, New Zealand National Film Unit, John Maynard and Geoff Steven
results.brief_description: Beyond the Great Wall of China lies “the power of the ancient dynasties and the new red star of communism”. This film explores the juxtaposition of China’s ancient heritage with its continuing advances into technology, communism and subtle trends into westernisation.

results.title: The Human skeleton. Part 3. Muscles, movements and pressure
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Beryl Denman Lacey
results.brief_description: Shows the workings of muscles and tendons within the human skeletal structure, with main emphasis on the diaphragm and the muscles required to maintain a human in an erect position.

results.title: The Human skeleton. Part 2. Muscles, movement and posture
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Beryl Denman Lacey
results.brief_description: Shows by live-action, animated diagram and radiology, the position, attachment, and function of the muscles relative to the bones and joints; the movements of the arm and of respiration; and the action of the muscles in maintaining posture in the standing and moving positions.

results.title: The Human machine
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems which confront people with physical disabilities and the ways modern technology can help them. Shows research and production of artificial limbs, the manner in which people with limited movements can become mobile and learn to communicate. Presented by James Dibble. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Human journey: the job
results.creator_credit: CTV Television Network and Jerry Lewton
results.brief_description: Examines the possible restructuring of jobs to suit individuals and human nature, to provide responsibility and challenge, and to ease the frustrations currently felt by so many workers.
